thread.title: Treefort Festival 2017 adds a handful of Denver bands
thread.title_full: Treefort Festival 2017 adds a handful of Denver bands

author: Dylan Owens
title: Treefort Festival 2017 adds a handful of Denver bands
text:
Treefort Festival 2017 adds a handful of Denver bands Dressy Bessy, Wheelchair Sports Camp and more will represent Denver at the Boise music festival. By Dylan Owens , The Know January 5, 2017 Print Behold the second round of Treefort’s 2017 lineup. Image via the festival. 
Boise, Idaho’s Treefort Music Festival has added a second wave of bands to its 2017 lineup, including a handful of Denver locals. 
Dressy Bessy, Wheelchair Sports Camp, Bud Bronson & The Good Timers, CRL CRRLL, Bad Licks and OKO TYGRA will join the likes of already-announced locals like Flaural, Shady Elders, The Raven & the Writing Desk and The Outfit. 
Those local yokels will join the ranks of festival headliners like Mac Demarco, STRFKR, Deafheaven and many more. Check out all the new bands added to the lineup below, and see the initial lineup here . 
Passes to Treefort 2017 are $169-$999 and are on sale now . Treefort Music Festival 2017 lineup, round two 
Touché Amoré
